comments.body: You might not need this ClipRRect.  Instead, try applying the shape to the decorations.  I think the blur effect uses the alpha channel to determine where to apply.
ah interesting. I was trying it before but I didn't understand how it worked. I think the modal barrier causes a scoping problem.

This is an odd semantic. Does it not do anything else?

Maybe we should call it "recommended"? Does iOS call it "default"?

Apple seems to use the same wording https://developer.apple.com/ios/human-interface-guidelines/ui-views/alerts/

Renamed to isDefaultAction to be more specific. Renamed isDestructive to isDestructiveAction too for categorisation
Is this for preventing the dialog box from touching the edge of the screen? Just wondering why vertical only.
Yes, it's to keep it inset from the edge.  The dialog has a fixed width, so there's no reason to do it horizontally.

comments.body: Wondering whether we should have a text size aware proportional edge inset. Would this happen commonly?
Yeah, that's probably a good idea.  Here I was just emulating what happens on iOS when the text size increases, and it probably happens other places.
